replayed this for the first time since it originally came out aside from some outdated gameplay quirks it brought me right back to the first time i played it as a kid i remember being so excited to experience command  conquer on the ground levelin firstperson just remember to install the community made patches and you are good to go the mp still works as well

the little launcher opens fine but when you start the game from there it closes im not gonna recommend a game that doesnt work without tinkering with it games should just work after you install them and if theyre still sold on steam they still should work

i am playing through renegade once again but this time on steam the map doesnt work at all and my assault rifle disappeared it never came back into my inventory after it went away my whole row of guns at the top shows up as matrix letter jibberish instead of showing my weapons you glitch with clipping in some areas but that was in the gog version too this is one of my favorite games and they kinda fucked it up but yeah
reminds me of halflife huuuuge areas and looooong tunnels some missions are annoying af been busy retrying to the point i cant enjoy the story one playthrough is enough

classic game logic quick and chaotic

the single player action is sort of hollow in ways i cant really describe it but its worth at least a single play through especially if youre a cc fan 6 out of 10 however the multiplayer is so much fun  makes up for the lack luck sp mode 9 out 10 for the mp the over all game is well worth it 75 out of 10
lots of nostalgia in this game for me still a lot of fun

one of the games of all time dont play if you dont like crusty graphics cheesy writing and bad facial animations dont play on anything higher than recruit unless you hate yourself

if you installplay this game thinking its a standard command  conquer title this is not it its a doom clone  i came to it from this perspective like doomduke nukem 3d  command  conquer renegade is like those games in general very nicely designed unique fun play  it has a nice cc flavour music art and surprises its just fun  for what it is it is a good game

interesting fps that allows you to better experience the scale of gdi and nod in the command and conquer universe but it is very clunky indeed levels are huge and take a long time to traverse buildings are a maze of corridors and lifts and navigating them is a pain infrequent saves and crashes are also present which is less than ideal to sum up might have been good when it first released but it hasnt aged well and is too clunky to be enjoyed fully

great game and well worth picking up just be warned it does have some bugs i had several areas where i got stuck in the terrain and 1 crash to desktop and the last level is plagued with graphical anomalies i know its over 20yrs old now but would be nice if it could be updated to run smoother but still a very playable and enjoyable game even now

its still fun just like the years before but beware the junk of the old fps is very real in this game and if you are playing on the hardest diff it can be a true pain however the line conflict of interests i am interested in conflict makes it all worth it

great campaign the story is kinda cliche but still fun its like your typical american action movie with all the cheesy lines each mission was more difficult than the other always presenting a challenge playing havoc was really cool
